greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into prime divisors of n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: Coefficient of x^n in expansion of 1/Product_{d is prime divisor of n} (1-x^d). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 11 2004
maple: a:= proc(n) local b, l; l:= sort([factorset(n)[]]):
mathematica: a[0] = 1; a[n_] := SeriesCoefficient[1/Product[1-x^d, {d, FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]}], {x, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 100}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jul 30 2015, after _Vladeta Jovovic_ *)
results.author: _Naohiro Nomoto_, Jan 26 2002
